attributes.action: Stop nurses paying £120 to be able to work for the NHS
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough common sense in running the NHS and the recent mess with PPE and vaccine development and the overspend and wasteful contract placements indicates that a root and branch reform is required of the NHS
attributes.background: Stop nurses having to pay a fee to work for the NHS and treat patients as well as pay for parking.  Parking fees were re-applied the day Tom Moore received his knighthood for doing what the government should have been doing.  There were 80,000 nurses and doctors who could have been acknowledged

rejection.details:
The level of registrations fees are a matter for independent regulators such as the General Medical Council and Nursing and Midwifery Council, and not the Government or Parliament.

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to fund health regulators directly, so they do not need to charge a registration fee, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

You might also like to sign this petition:

Forever Free Parking for NHS and Care Workers
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313385
